field.label: Enabled
field.help: Checking this box enables Suricata inspection on the interface.

field.label: Interface
field.help: Choose which interface this Suricata instance applies to. In most cases, you will want to choose LAN here if this is the first Suricata-configured interface.

field.label: Description
field.help: Enter a meaningful description here for your reference. The default is the DynFi Firewall interface friendly description.

field.label: Send Alerts to System Log
field.help: Suricata will send Alerts from this interface to the firewall's system log.

field.label: Log Facility
field.help: Select system log Facility to use for reporting.

field.label: Log Priority
field.help: Select system log Priority to use for reporting.

field.label: Enable Stats Collection
field.help: Suricata will periodically gather performance statistics for this interface.

field.label: Stats Update Interval
field.help: Enter the update interval in seconds for collection of performance statistics.

field.label: Enable Stats Log
field.help: Suricata will periodically log statistics for this interface to a CSV text log file.

field.label: Enable Telegraf Stats
field.help: Suricata will periodically log statistics for this interface to Telegraf via a Unix socket.

field.label: Enable HTTP Log
field.help: Suricata will log decoded HTTP traffic for the interface.

field.label: Append HTTP Log
field.help: Suricata will append-to instead of clearing HTTP log file when restarting.

field.label: Log Extended HTTP Info
field.help: Suricata will log extended HTTP information.

field.label: Enable TLS Log
field.help: Suricata will log TLS handshake traffic for the interface.

field.label: Enable File-Store
field.help: Suricata will extract and store files from application layer streams. WARNING: Enabling file-store will consume a significant amount of disk space on a busy network!

field.label: Enable Packet Log
field.help: Suricata will log decoded packets for the interface in pcap-format. Default is Not Checked. This can consume a significant amount of disk space when enabled.

field.label: Enable Verbose Logging
field.help: Suricata will log additional information to the suricata.log file when starting up and shutting down.
